programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25

programme.desc: A Premier League clash at Villa Park with both teams coming from defeat, as European hopefuls Aston Villa and relegation-threatened Ipswich target a return to winning ways. (15.02)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: Nuno Espirito Santo and Nottingham Forest bring back-to-back wins to the capital, as Thomas Frank's Brentford look to end the visitors' winning run at the Gtech Community Stadium. (21.12)

programme.desc: Guy Martin explores the legacy of the biggest-ever nuclear disaster in Chernobyl and the engineering solutions designed to make the area safe.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: Cambodia and Vietnam: Rick Stein is on an epic culinary journey through the Far East's diverse food cultures. In Cambodia, he enjoys swimmer crabs and samples the local beef dish lok lak.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Gwent: The hugely popular reality series comes to the UK. Heavy D confuses the other bidders, Sean and indeed himself! A 'classic car' could well turn out to be an old banger.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Leeds: Auction warfare in the wheeler-dealer reality series. Tensions run high as the Americans come to town. A pig skin and a suit of armour are among the goods up for grabs.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Birmingham: Cut-throat bidding as savvy storage experts battle for lucrative lots. Helium, horses and a box of inflatables are all up for grabs, while Nat and John clash.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Royston: Sparks fly in the confrontational reality series - quite literally this time, as a storage bin goes up in smoke! A mystery object under tarpaulin causes a catfight.

programme.title: Our Guy in Colombia
programme.desc: After getting kidnapped, tortured and shot, Guy Martin heads off to see how easy it is to buy drugs in Medellin, a place once known as the most dangerous city in the world.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: High-octane entertainment. Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond are on location with the Sweeney movie and taking charge of the film's climactic car chase, and Ryan Reynolds guests.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Fasten your seatbelts for more motoring mayhem. The boys embark on a project to build mobility scooters that can tackle the British countryside.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British

programme.desc: Cambodia and Vietnam: Rick Stein is on an epic culinary journey through the Far East's diverse food cultures. In Cambodia, he enjoys swimmer crabs and samples the local beef dish lok lak.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon, Lee Mack and David Mitchell sort fact from fiction with guests John Cooper Clarke, Judi Love, Chris McCausland and Caroline Quentin.

programme.title: Baggage Battles

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Platinum Hits. The baggage battlers head to a music icons auction in New York. They find a gold disc for the Pink Floyd album 'Dark Side Of The Moon' and a nude photo of Madonna. S3, Ep9

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Mustang Time Machine. Dave Jensen asks Andy to restore his dad's 1964 Mustang. Plus, Jen wants to sell her Jeep but when Andy decides to fix it up, she throws a wrench in his plans. S4, Ep9

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Wrecked Wrangler Rehab. Andy and his dad Bobby restore a couple of classics: A Jeep Wrangler that's an American icon, and a 1986 Monte Carlo once known as 'The Heartbeat of America.' S4, Ep10

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Junkyard Driftin'. Andy squeezes a Hemi engine into a Jeep Wrangler for a power boost. Jeff revives an '86 RX-7 with a Corvette LT1 motor, and Tim rehabs a trashed Boston Whaler. S4, Ep11

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Father-Son Run. When Andy has another try at the world speed record for tow trucks in his Racing Wrecker, Bobby plans to take him on in a 1979 Zephyr with a hot new engine. S4, Ep12

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Jag E-Type. This classic Jag is one of the best-looking cars in the world and Mike gladly takes a risk on a wreck. But the price of parts is huge - will the project crash and burn? S8, Ep1

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Frogeye Sprite. Mike attempts to double his money by turning an old Frogeye Sprite into a premiership quality classic car to be test driven around the Brooklands Motor Museum. S8, Ep4

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Morgan. Mike is seduced by a stunning Morgan Plus 4 at only 13,000, but it needs a new chassis and fitting it will take at least a hundred man hours. How will Edd react? S9, Ep2

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Caterham 7. Mike has always wanted to get an old Caterham into the workshop, but when Edd decides to take a risk by painting it a shocking colour will the risk pay off? S12, Ep13

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Lotus Europa. Mike returns Elvis to his F1 roots with a car from a big name in British racing: a Lotus Europa. Elvis is excited - until he takes it out for a spin. S17, Ep8

programme.desc: Underground Tsunami. Searching for the hidden entrance to the cave system, the team finds an ancient vent shaft above the Energy Zone but are thrown off by an explosion. S3, Ep2

programme.desc: The Proton Displacement: Sheldon is jealous when Professor Proton asks Leonard to read his latest publication, so he befriends a TV personality from a rival science show.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Itchy Brain Simulation: Leonard worries that Sheldon will overreact when he confesses that he failed to return a DVD to the rental shop seven years earlier.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Thanksgiving Decoupling: Howard takes the gang to his mother's house for Thanksgiving to protect himself from his grumpy father-in-law who has also been invited.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Cowboy Aerobics and 473 Grease-Free Bolts: Sheldon campaigns to become Dr Linkletter's lab assistant. Georgie enlists the help of drama teacher Mr Lundy.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Pager, a Club and a Cranky Bag of Wrinkles: Dr Linkletter pushes Sheldon to make friends with his fellow students, and Georgie gets a pager.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Do Not Push: A campus tour becomes an emotionally and psychologically charged experience for the Dunphys.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Cold: Phil must get rid of some incriminating footage on Mitch and Cam's wedding video.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Simpson Christmas Stories: Homer shares his version of Jesus's birth, Grampa tells a Yuletide war story, and Springfield prepares for Christmas.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer's Paternity Coot: The Simpsons receive a long-lost letter, which suggests that Homer's biological father is actually British treasure hunter Mason Fairbanks.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Proton Transmogrification: Sheldon struggles to process his feelings of grief when his idol Professor Proton passes away. The gang gather to celebrate Star Wars Day.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Gorilla Dissolution: Penny re-evaluates her life, including taking a big step with Leonard, while Howard and Bernadette struggle to look after Mrs Wolowitz.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Status Quo Combustion: With potential changes affecting different aspects of his personal and professional life, Sheldon is forced to confront an uncertain future.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Replaceable You: When Homer loses his job to his eager new assistant, he teams up with Ned to reveal her evil past.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Tragedy strikes as one resident's fate is revealed, and Liberty is shattered by hidden truths. Clare's return sends chills through the village. And is Grace's conscience finally showing?

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Clown in the Dumps: Krusty loses confidence and retires from showbusiness after his father dies without ever giving approval to his career. Lisa frets about Homer's health.

programme.title: New: Below Deck Down Under
programme.desc: Brand new series - Anchors Astray!: A deckhand's unhappy being friend-zoned, a forbidden relationship becomes too tempting to ignore, and a disastrous mistake endangers the boat.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: On the Box this time, Strictly Come Dancing, Vigil, Serengeti II, Come Dine with Me, Ambulance, Hotel Paranormal, The Andrew Marr Show (Keir Starmer) and ITV News (petrol crisis).

programme.title: American Pie 2
programme.desc: (2001) Crude, still-coming-of-age comedy with Jason Biggs and Eugene Levy. The lads' shenanigans continue as they return from college to do it - or not - all again.

programme.title: John Wick: Chapter 3 - Parabellum
programme.desc: (2019) Keanu Reeves returns for the third time as the supposedly retired hitman. This time, someone's put a contract on John Wick's head and only a mystic in Morocco can lift it.

programme.title: Smile
programme.desc: (2022) Gory horror with Sosie Bacon. Following a traumatic incident, a psychiatrist is haunted by a malevolent, gurning presence that drives people to gruesomely kill themselves. Or is she?

programme.title: Spontaneous
programme.desc: (2020) Darkly comic teen horror. Will a spate of unexplained spontaneous combustions affect Mara and Dylan's romance? Strong language/gore/drugs.

programme.title: Playing with Fire
programme.desc: (2019) Fun-filled family comedy starring John Cena. A macho fireman has to babysit three impish kids after saving them from a blaze in the remote California woodlands.

programme.title: Young Winston
programme.desc: (1972) Biopic charting the rise of the future PM from battered Harrow pupil to MP via military action on foreign soil. Directed by Richard Attenborough.

programme.title: Goodbye Christopher Robin
programme.desc: (2017) Biographical drama exploring the relationship between writer A. A. Milne and his son Christopher Robin, which inspired one of literature's most beloved creations - Winnie the Pooh.

programme.title: The Banshees of Inisherin...
programme.desc: ...Interview Special: The In Bruges team of Colin Farrell, Brendan Gleeson and writer/director Martin McDonagh talk about making their new film together, The Banshees of Inisherin.

programme.title: Midway
programme.desc: (2019) Roland Emmerich's sprawling, action-packed war drama about the Battle of Midway, a major turning point in World War II. Starring Ed Skrein, Luke Evans and Woody Harrelson.

programme.title: The Banshees of Inisherin...
programme.desc: ...Interview Special: The In Bruges team of Colin Farrell, Brendan Gleeson and writer/director Martin McDonagh talk about making their new film together, The Banshees of Inisherin.

programme.title: Armageddon
programme.desc: (1998) Michael Bay's star-studded disaster movie starring Bruce Willis. The world's greatest drillers are sent into space to nuke a huge asteroid that's hurtling towards Earth.

programme.title: Piggy
programme.desc: (2022) Suspenseful slasher horror starring Laura Galn as a bullied teenager whose tormentors get what's coming to 'em, but perhaps not in a way she'd fully support... In Spanish/subs.

programme.title: The Woman in the Fifth
programme.desc: (1997) Drama with Ethan Hawke and Kristin Scott Thomas. A lonely writer falls for a mysterious and possibly dangerous woman in Paris. In English/French/Polish/subs. Strong language/sex.

programme.title: Tad the Lost Explorer and the...
programme.desc: ...Curse of the Mummy: (2022) Animated family adventure. After Tad accidentally unleashes a curse - doh! - he and his friends must find the Emerald Tablet to save the world.

programme.title: Cat Ballou
programme.desc: (1965) Oscar-winning comedy western starring Jane Fonda and Lee Marvin. She's trying to defend her father's ranch from developers, he's the drunken gunslinger she hires for the job.

programme.title: Turner & Hooch
programme.desc: (1989) Comedy-thriller starring Tom Hanks. A cop investigates a murder to which there's just one witness: Hooch, a slobbering, beer-drinking French mastiff, who now needs 24/7 protection.

programme.title: Groundhog Day
programme.desc: (1993) Harold Ramis's classic dj-vu comedy starring Bill Murray. A TV weatherman must relive the same day reporting on a clairvoyant groundhog until he learns to behave himself.

programme.title: Hunter Killer
programme.desc: (2018) Nautical action thriller. Gerard Butler stars as an unconventional submarine skipper sent to investigate the torpedoing of a US vessel. With Gary Oldman, Linda Cardellini and Common.

programme.title: Peppermint
programme.desc: (2018) Revenge thriller with Jennifer Garner. A mum turns vigilante on a quest for justice when her husband and daughter are murdered by a drug cartel.

programme.title: Our Ladies
programme.desc: (2019) Raucous teen comedy. A group of Catholic school girls hit Edinburgh for a choir competition, but they're more interested in debauchery than singing.

programme.title: Skin
programme.desc: (2018) Intense biographical drama starring Jamie Bell as a Neo-Nazi skinhead who decides to leave his racist beliefs behind.

programme.title: The Winslow Boy

programme.title: River of No Return
programme.desc: (1954) Western with Robert Mitchum and Marilyn Monroe. An ex-con and a saloon singer steer a raft through hostile territory to face a showdown with her crooked fianc. With Rory Calhoun.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill

programme.title: Three Billboards Interview Special

programme.desc: ...Curse of the Mummy: (2022) Animated family adventure. After Tad accidentally unleashes a curse - doh! - he and his friends must find the Emerald Tablet to save the world.

programme.title: Cat Ballou
programme.desc: (1965) Oscar-winning comedy western starring Jane Fonda and Lee Marvin. She's trying to defend her father's ranch from developers, he's the drunken gunslinger she hires for the job.

programme.title: Turner & Hooch
programme.desc: (1989) Comedy-thriller starring Tom Hanks. A cop investigates a murder to which there's just one witness: Hooch, a slobbering, beer-drinking French mastiff, who now needs 24/7 protection.

programme.title: Groundhog Day
programme.desc: (1993) Harold Ramis's classic dj-vu comedy starring Bill Murray. A TV weatherman must relive the same day reporting on a clairvoyant groundhog until he learns to behave himself.

programme.title: Hunter Killer
programme.desc: (2018) Nautical action thriller. Gerard Butler stars as an unconventional submarine skipper sent to investigate the torpedoing of a US vessel. With Gary Oldman, Linda Cardellini and Common.

programme.title: Peppermint
programme.desc: (2018) Revenge thriller with Jennifer Garner. A mum turns vigilante on a quest for justice when her husband and daughter are murdered by a drug cartel.

programme.title: Our Ladies
programme.desc: (2019) Raucous teen comedy. A group of Catholic school girls hit Edinburgh for a choir competition, but they're more interested in debauchery than singing.

programme.title: Skin
programme.desc: (2018) Intense biographical drama starring Jamie Bell as a Neo-Nazi skinhead who decides to leave his racist beliefs behind.

programme.title: The Winslow Boy
programme.desc: (1948) Anthony Asquith's drama based on a famous 1912 court case with Cedric Hardwicke as the father of a boy accused of theft who pursues the case to the highest courts. With Robert Donat.

programme.title: River of No Return
programme.desc: (1954) Western with Robert Mitchum and Marilyn Monroe. An ex-con and a saloon singer steer a raft through hostile territory to face a showdown with her crooked fianc. With Rory Calhoun.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: (1954) Western starring Dana Andrews. A man falsely accused of murder gets a last-minute reprieve from the lynch mob so he can track down the real culprit.

programme.title: Three Billboards Interview Special
programme.desc: Writer-director Martin McDonagh and star Sam Rockwell talk about making the comedy-drama about one woman's unconventional fight for justice.

programme.title: The Wrong Box
programme.desc: (1966) Dark comedy with John Mills, Ralph Richardson and Michael Caine. Two brothers clash over money that their parents left to their last surviving child, with chaotic consequences.

programme.title: Old Boys
programme.desc: (2018) Charming comedy set in an all-boys school in the 80s. An awkward geek gets caught in a love triangle with a teacher's daughter and the school sports star.

programme.title: Man on Fire
programme.desc: (2004) Revenge thriller with Denzel Washington. An ex-CIA agent who's trying to start a new life in Mexico seeks brutal retribution when the girl who he's been hired to guard is kidnapped.

programme.desc: Thanksgiving: Animated US comedy. Lois cooks a big Thanksgiving meal and invites the whole crew over for dinner. Joe is shocked when his formerly MIA son Kevin returns from Iraq.

programme.desc: American Stepdad: Animated series. Stan's mother Betty moves in with the Smiths, forcing Roger out of his attic. The next day, Roger and Betty announce they are married.

programme.desc: Less Money, Mo' Problems: Animated series about a hapless CIA agent. After accusing Hayley and Jeff of freeloading, Stan bets that he and Francine can live frugally for a month.

programme.desc: Some Like It Bot Part Two: Judge-Bot Day: Animated comedy. Driven over the edge by the news segment, Tina decides to break into the school to destroy the Wagstaff News touchscreen.

programme.title: Press Preview

programme.title: Mel Giedroyc and Martin Clunes Explore Britain by the Book
programme.desc: The acting friends head to Dorset to explore the spectacular scenery and locations made famous by some of Britain's favourite books and films. They walk in the footsteps of Meryl Streep's French Lieutenant's Woman, stoke up the engine on a steam train ride through Enid Blyton country and take a boat trip to the world-famous Durdle Door on the breathtaking Jurassic coast, which proves challenging for the sea-sick Mel despite Martin's best efforts at distracting her by reading bursts of Thomas Hardy

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by actress Fiona Wade, while hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform the style of an endometriosis campaigner. Aldo Zilli rustles up mocktails and joins Katie for an ice bath

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh heads to Swindon to surprise Lorraine, a retired RAF servicewoman and devoted charity volunteer. Because of a spinal injury, Lorraine struggles with mobility issues and lives with her full-time support team - Leonbergers Poppy and Doris. Poppy is a retired therapy dog and Doris is Lorraine's assistance dog, and helps with chores such as laundry and fetching household items. The team creates a fabulous low-maintenance garden as a calming retreat for both Lorraine and her canine family

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan at Manor Farm are Anita Dobson, Tom Allen and Amol Rajan, while horticulturalist Camilla Bassett-Smith opens the pages of her summer diary. There is a catch-up with the brown bears currently residing at Jimmy's farm, while Andy Clarke has the best in festival drinks and nibbles

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by singer, actress and presenter Toyah Willcox. It's time to spruce up the guinea pig enclosure at the wildlife park and test out some TikTok cooking hacks back in the kitchen, while local upcycler Sarah joins the trio to show everyone how to glam up their lampshades

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Opening Show - Derby Day Special
programme.desc: Oli Bell and the team are at Epsom ahead of the 2025 Derby, the penultimate British classic of the season

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James looks forward to Soccer Aid 2025 with Harry Redknapp, cooks for classical singer Carly Paoli and enjoys recipes from chefs Sally Abe and Daniel Clifford

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing Live: The Derby
programme.desc: Coverage of day two of the Derby meeting from Epsom, headlined by The Derby

programme.title: European Qualifier
programme.desc: Andorra v England (Kick-off 5.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the FIFA World Cup Group K qualifier at RCDE Stadium in Barcelona. England got off to a perfect start to their campaign and Thomas Tuchel's reign as manager with home wins against Albania and Latvia, as Harry Kane extended his record number of England goals with a strike in each game. They will expect nothing less than another win against Andorra, who have already lost to both the teams the Three Lions defeated. With analysis from Roy Keane and Karen Carney, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon

programme.title: Deal or No Deal for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a special charity edition as The Last Leg co-host Alex Brooker goes up against the infamous Banker, supported on the wings by his Soccer Aid family. Can Alex choose the right boxes and resist the tempting cash offers until just the right moment to bag a huge cash prize for Unicef?

programme.title: The 1% Club for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Lee Mack hosts a special charity edition of the quiz in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred sports stars and celebrities begin the show, but who will make it to the end and win up to 100,000 for charity

programme.title: It'll Be Alright on the Night
programme.desc: David Walliams narrates a selection of behind-the-scenes bloopers and live broadcast blunders, with out-takes from Strictly Come Dancing, Blankety Blank, Coronation Street, Emmerdale, Antiques Road Trip, Love Island and many more

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Fake
programme.desc: While Birdie is at the airport waiting for Joe, he joins his other girlfriend Kirsty at a couples counselling session, secretly visits his mum at her nursing home without his brothers knowing and refuses to sign divorce papers when his ex-wife Mary suddenly arrives. He then tries to save his family home by bidding on it at auction with money he doesn't have

programme.title: Road to Perdition
programme.desc: Period crime drama starring Tom Hanks and Paul Newman. The Midwest in the 1930s: when the profession of ruthless hitman Michael Sullivan is discovered, a killer is sent to eradicate him and his family. But Sullivan and his 12-year-old son escape and embark upon a life-changing journey of revenge.

programme.title: Dame Maggie Smith: A Celebration
programme.desc: A tribute to the celebrated and enigmatic actress, with her life story told by those who knew her best, celebrating her much-loved appearances across film and TV spanning almost 70 years. Smith, who died in September 2024, had gained a new level of popularity playing the razor-tongued Lady Violet Crawley in Downton Abbey, but for all her success, remained a very private person who had little time for the trappings that came with fame. The film tells the story of a girl born in pre-war Essex who, against the odds, took Broadway and the West End by storm before eventually becoming one of the world's most popular and respected performers

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Gary Barlow's Food and Wine Tour: Australia
programme.desc: Gary is in South Australia to meet his old friend Andi Peters. Starting their journey at the Yalumba Winery in the Barossa Valley, the duo try barrel-making, encounter the rare bees of Kangaroo Island, and visit the famous McLaren Vale, before blending their own vino with the Willy Wonka of Wine

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, featuring the return of Roll It and phone game Left Hanging as well as the chance for people to win a thousand pounds in In for A Penny, In for a Grand

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James looks forward to Soccer Aid 2025 with Harry Redknapp, cooks for classical singer Carly Paoli and enjoys recipes from chefs Sally Abe and Daniel Clifford

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Joe Wicks to try South African dancing, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform the show's first male guest of honour, and Aldo Zilli dishes up a delicious brunch

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: The host is joined by actress Barbara Flynn and The Repair Shop stars Julie Tatchell and Amanda Middleditch. Alan also gets a masterclass in milking goats, surveys some vintage bicycles and samples the best red wines for summer

programme.title: Jeremy Pang's Hong Kong Kitchen
programme.desc: Jeremy is joined by businessman and good friend Tom Skinner to enjoy Hong Kong's nod to an English fry-up and go on the ultimate street food tour around the central part of the city. Tom also gets to experience Hong Kong's famous fish market, which ends with a royal banquet, and is set up with a surprise visit to the city's oldest stamp carver and curator for a little holiday memento. Along the way, Jeremy's recipes include cheung fun, a savoury doughnut topped with a sweetened soy sauce

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Camilla Bassett-Smith explores a historic Scottish palace and gardens, Henry Agg builds a DIY pergola, Martha Swales offers a special allotment tour with her dad, and Errol Reuben Fernandes visits a unique Berkshire garden

programme.title: Jumanji
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring Robin Williams. In 1969, a young boy called Alan gets trapped in the strange jungle world of a magical board game he has unearthed on a building site. Twenty-six years later, two children discover the game and unwittingly unleash its dangerous magic. They also release Alan, now an adult, who realises that to escape the game they must play it to the end.

programme.title: You Only Live Twice
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Sean Connery and Donald Pleasence. When international crime syndicate Spectre captures an American spaceship in the hope of starting the Third World War, James Bond is dispatched to Japan to face arch villain Blofeld, the man behind the evil scheme.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Sean's Scotland
programme.desc: Sean Batty travels to the Black Isle, where he visits a local brewery and the Cromarty Community Cinema before going dolphin watching and finding out about Scotland's first managed coastal realignment.

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: Fergus Sutherland explores his home town of Cumbernauld, and Jennifer Reoch goes to Benbecula to find out about the time a grizzly bear called Hercules went missing on the island

programme.title: UEFA Nations League Final
programme.desc: Portugal v Spain (Kick-off 8.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the showpiece match, held at Allianz Arena in Munich. Portugal came back from behind to defeat Germany 2-1 in the semi-finals and are now looking to emulate their triumph in the inaugural staging of this tournament in 2019. However, they face a tough test against Spain, who are the holders and withstood a late fightback from France in the last four to prevail 5-4. With analysis from Karen Carney and Guillem Balague, and commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Andros Townsend

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Island: Decade of Love
programme.desc: Memorable contestants from the past decade of Love Island reunite for an unmissable anniversary event, from explosive recouplings and shock bombshells to the love stories that captured the nation. They reflect on unforgettable moments from the villa and look back at previously unseen audition clips

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents action from Donington Park with racing from the Porsche Carrera Cup Great Britain and the Wera Tools F4 British Championship.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Jeremy Pang's Hong Kong Kitchen
programme.desc: The chef goes on a culinary trip to Hong Kong, with celebrity friends joining him to delve into the heart of Cantonese culture and its world-famous gastronomy. His companion for the first instalment is Mel Giedroyc, with the pair taking in the sights, sampling a variety of street food and ending at one of Hong Kong's institutions for the best dim sum in town

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Alan shares more practical tips and seasonal highlights from his own patch, Anna Greenland explores the renowned dry garden at Hyde Hall in Essex and offers inspiration for planting in hot and dry conditions without compromising on beauty. Houseplant expert Claire Lowrie returns to tackle some of the most common indoor plant dilemmas

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts the quiz in which three pairs of contestants use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. This edition features features mother and son Sharon and Sean from Norfolk, Nottingham siblings Amit and Alon, and Linda and her son-in-law Peter from Bromsgrove

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Kerry, Ellena, Alex and Fraser pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: John is questioned by the police, Tracy tries to defend herself, and Jacob learns Sarah's secret

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Brody complains about Kit's harassment, Millie drops a bombshell on Todd, Lou begs a favour of Gary, Toyah warns Ronnie not to mess Leanne around, and Carla shares her concern for Lisa with Betsy

programme.title: Shardlake
programme.desc: Dark deeds are perpetrated in a 16th-century English monastery in a four-part thriller adapted by screenwriter Stephen Butchard from the first book in CJ Sansom's series of novels. Idealistic lawyer Matthew Shardlake (Arthur Hughes) works for Thomas Cromwell (Sean Bean) and is dedicated to serving justice and the Crown. He is flanked by cocky assistant Jack Barak (Anthony Boyle), who could be a spy for Cromwell. Shardlake is living with scoliosis and is rudely dismissed as a 'crookback' by Tudor society as he carries out his duties. Weathering the verbal abuse, Shardlake and Barak travel to the remote town of Scarnsea to investigate the murder of a commissioner, who was gathering evidence for Cromwell to close the local monastery. The duo are met with hostility and suspicion as they seek answers from Abbot Fabian (Babou Ceesay) and a secretive brotherhood including Edwig (David Pearse), Gabriel (Miles Barrow), Guy (Irfan Shamji), Jerome (Paul Kaye) and Mortimus (Brian Vernel)

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: Love Island
programme.desc: A fresh batch of singles prepare for the summer of a lifetime in the ultimate search for love, with host Maya Jama overseeing proceedings at the villa in Majorca

programme.title: Goldfinger
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Sean Connery. Agent 007 James Bond investigates ruthless criminal Auric Goldfinger, a man with an insatiable appetite for gold and a desire to become the most powerful man on Earth.

programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions

programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective

programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Alan shares more practical tips and seasonal highlights from his own patch, Anna Greenland explores the renowned dry garden at Hyde Hall in Essex and offers inspiration for planting in hot and dry conditions without compromising on beauty. Houseplant expert Claire Lowrie returns to tackle some of the most common indoor plant dilemmas

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts the quiz in which three pairs of contestants use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. This edition features features mother and son Sharon and Sean from Norfolk, Nottingham siblings Amit and Alon, and Linda and her son-in-law Peter from Bromsgrove

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Kerry, Ellena, Alex and Fraser pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: John is questioned by the police, Tracy tries to defend herself, and Jacob learns Sarah's secret

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Brody complains about Kit's harassment, Millie drops a bombshell on Todd, Lou begs a favour of Gary, Toyah warns Ronnie not to mess Leanne around, and Carla shares her concern for Lisa with Betsy

programme.title: Shardlake
programme.desc: Dark deeds are perpetrated in a 16th-century English monastery in a four-part thriller adapted by screenwriter Stephen Butchard from the first book in CJ Sansom's series of novels. Idealistic lawyer Matthew Shardlake (Arthur Hughes) works for Thomas Cromwell (Sean Bean) and is dedicated to serving justice and the Crown. He is flanked by cocky assistant Jack Barak (Anthony Boyle), who could be a spy for Cromwell. Shardlake is living with scoliosis and is rudely dismissed as a 'crookback' by Tudor society as he carries out his duties. Weathering the verbal abuse, Shardlake and Barak travel to the remote town of Scarnsea to investigate the murder of a commissioner, who was gathering evidence for Cromwell to close the local monastery. The duo are met with hostility and suspicion as they seek answers from Abbot Fabian (Babou Ceesay) and a secretive brotherhood including Edwig (David Pearse), Gabriel (Miles Barrow), Guy (Irfan Shamji), Jerome (Paul Kaye) and Mortimus (Brian Vernel)

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: Love Island
programme.desc: A fresh batch of singles prepare for the summer of a lifetime in the ultimate search for love, with host Maya Jama overseeing proceedings at the villa in Majorca

programme.title: Mel Giedroyc and Martin Clunes Explore Britain by the Book
programme.desc: The acting friends head to Dorset to explore the spectacular scenery and locations made famous by some of Britain's favourite books and films. They walk in the footsteps of Meryl Streep's French Lieutenant's Woman, stoke up the engine on a steam train ride through Enid Blyton country and take a boat trip to the world-famous Durdle Door on the breathtaking Jurassic coast, which proves challenging for the sea-sick Mel despite Martin's best efforts at distracting her by reading bursts of Thomas Hardy

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by actress Fiona Wade, while hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform the style of an endometriosis campaigner. Aldo Zilli rustles up mocktails and joins Katie for an ice bath

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh heads to Swindon to surprise Lorraine, a retired RAF servicewoman and devoted charity volunteer. Because of a spinal injury, Lorraine struggles with mobility issues and lives with her full-time support team - Leonbergers Poppy and Doris. Poppy is a retired therapy dog and Doris is Lorraine's assistance dog, and helps with chores such as laundry and fetching household items. The team creates a fabulous low-maintenance garden as a calming retreat for both Lorraine and her canine family

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan at Manor Farm are Anita Dobson, Tom Allen and Amol Rajan, while horticulturalist Camilla Bassett-Smith opens the pages of her summer diary. There is a catch-up with the brown bears currently residing at Jimmy's farm, while Andy Clarke has the best in festival drinks and nibbles

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by singer, actress and presenter Toyah Willcox. It's time to spruce up the guinea pig enclosure at the wildlife park and test out some TikTok cooking hacks back in the kitchen, while local upcycler Sarah joins the trio to show everyone how to glam up their lampshades

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: Oli Bell and the team are at Epsom ahead of the 2025 Derby, the penultimate British classic of the season

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing Live: The Derby
programme.desc: Coverage of day two of the Derby meeting from Epsom, headlined by The Derby

programme.title: European Qualifier
programme.desc: Andorra v England (Kick-off 5.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the FIFA World Cup Group K qualifier at RCDE Stadium in Barcelona. England got off to a perfect start to their campaign and Thomas Tuchel's reign as manager with home wins against Albania and Latvia, as Harry Kane extended his record number of England goals with a strike in each game. They will expect nothing less than another win against Andorra, who have already lost to both the teams the Three Lions defeated. With analysis from Roy Keane and Karen Carney, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon

programme.title: Deal or No Deal for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a special charity edition as The Last Leg co-host Alex Brooker goes up against the infamous Banker, supported on the wings by his Soccer Aid family. Can Alex choose the right boxes and resist the tempting cash offers until just the right moment to bag a huge cash prize for Unicef?

programme.title: The 1% Club for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Lee Mack hosts a special charity edition of the quiz in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred sports stars and celebrities begin the show, but who will make it to the end and win up to 100,000 for charity

programme.title: It'll Be Alright on the Night
programme.desc: David Walliams narrates a selection of behind-the-scenes bloopers and live broadcast blunders, with out-takes from Strictly Come Dancing, Blankety Blank, Coronation Street, Emmerdale, Antiques Road Trip, Love Island and many more

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Fake
programme.desc: While Birdie is at the airport waiting for Joe, he joins his other girlfriend Kirsty at a couples counselling session, secretly visits his mum at her nursing home without his brothers knowing and refuses to sign divorce papers when his ex-wife Mary suddenly arrives. He then tries to save his family home by bidding on it at auction with money he doesn't have

programme.title: Road to Perdition
programme.desc: Period crime drama starring Tom Hanks and Paul Newman. The Midwest in the 1930s: when the profession of ruthless hitman Michael Sullivan is discovered, a killer is sent to eradicate him and his family. But Sullivan and his 12-year-old son escape and embark upon a life-changing journey of revenge.

programme.title: Dame Maggie Smith: A Celebration
programme.desc: A tribute to the celebrated and enigmatic actress, with her life story told by those who knew her best, celebrating her much-loved appearances across film and TV spanning almost 70 years. Smith, who died in September 2024, had gained a new level of popularity playing the razor-tongued Lady Violet Crawley in Downton Abbey, but for all her success, remained a very private person who had little time for the trappings that came with fame. The film tells the story of a girl born in pre-war Essex who, against the odds, took Broadway and the West End by storm before eventually becoming one of the world's most popular and respected performers

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Gary Barlow's Food and Wine Tour: Australia
programme.desc: Gary is in South Australia to meet his old friend Andi Peters. Starting their journey at the Yalumba Winery in the Barossa Valley, the duo try barrel-making, encounter the rare bees of Kangaroo Island, and visit the famous McLaren Vale, before blending their own vino with the Willy Wonka of Wine

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, featuring the return of Roll It and phone game Left Hanging as well as the chance for people to win a thousand pounds in In for A Penny, In for a Grand

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James looks forward to Soccer Aid 2025 with Harry Redknapp, cooks for classical singer Carly Paoli and enjoys recipes from chefs Sally Abe and Daniel Clifford

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: The host is joined by actress Barbara Flynn and The Repair Shop stars Julie Tatchell and Amanda Middleditch. Alan also gets a masterclass in milking goats, surveys some vintage bicycles and samples the best red wines for summer

programme.title: Jeremy Pang's Hong Kong Kitchen
programme.desc: Jeremy is joined by businessman and good friend Tom Skinner to enjoy Hong Kong's nod to an English fry-up and go on the ultimate street food tour around the central part of the city. Tom also gets to experience Hong Kong's famous fish market, which ends with a royal banquet, and is set up with a surprise visit to the city's oldest stamp carver and curator for a little holiday memento. Along the way, Jeremy's recipes include cheung fun, a savoury doughnut topped with a sweetened soy sauce

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Camilla Bassett-Smith explores a historic Scottish palace and gardens, Henry Agg builds a DIY pergola, Martha Swales offers a special allotment tour with her dad, and Errol Reuben Fernandes visits a unique Berkshire garden

programme.title: Jumanji
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring Robin Williams. In 1969, a young boy called Alan gets trapped in the strange jungle world of a magical board game he has unearthed on a building site. Twenty-six years later, two children discover the game and unwittingly unleash its dangerous magic. They also release Alan, now an adult, who realises that to escape the game they must play it to the end.

programme.title: You Only Live Twice
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Sean Connery and Donald Pleasence. When international crime syndicate Spectre captures an American spaceship in the hope of starting the Third World War, James Bond is dispatched to Japan to face arch villain Blofeld, the man behind the evil scheme.

programme.title: Sean's Scotland
programme.desc: Sean Batty travels to the Black Isle, where he visits a local brewery and the Cromarty Community Cinema before going dolphin watching and finding out about Scotland's first managed coastal realignment.

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: Fergus Sutherland explores his home town of Cumbernauld, and Jennifer Reoch goes to Benbecula to find out about the time a grizzly bear called Hercules went missing on the island

programme.title: UEFA Nations League Final
programme.desc: Portugal v Spain (Kick-off 8.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the showpiece match, held at Allianz Arena in Munich. Portugal came back from behind to defeat Germany 2-1 in the semi-finals and are now looking to emulate their triumph in the inaugural staging of this tournament in 2019. However, they face a tough test against Spain, who are the holders and withstood a late fightback from France in the last four to prevail 5-4. With analysis from Karen Carney and Guillem Balague, and commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Andros Townsend

His companion for the first instalment is Mel Giedroyc, with the pair taking in the sights, sampling a variety of street food and ending at one of Hong Kong's institutions for the best dim sum in town

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Alan shares more practical tips and seasonal highlights from his own patch, Anna Greenland explores the renowned dry garden at Hyde Hall in Essex and offers inspiration for planting in hot and dry conditions without compromising on beauty. Houseplant expert Claire Lowrie returns to tackle some of the most common indoor plant dilemmas

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts the quiz in which three pairs of contestants use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. This edition features features mother and son Sharon and Sean from Norfolk, Nottingham siblings Amit and Alon, and Linda and her son-in-law Peter from Bromsgrove

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Kerry, Ellena, Alex and Fraser pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: John is questioned by the police, Tracy tries to defend herself, and Jacob learns Sarah's secret

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Brody complains about Kit's harassment, Millie drops a bombshell on Todd, Lou begs a favour of Gary, Toyah warns Ronnie not to mess Leanne around, and Carla shares her concern for Lisa with Betsy

programme.title: Shardlake
programme.desc: Dark deeds are perpetrated in a 16th-century English monastery in a four-part thriller adapted by screenwriter Stephen Butchard from the first book in CJ Sansom's series of novels. Idealistic lawyer Matthew Shardlake (Arthur Hughes) works for Thomas Cromwell (Sean Bean) and is dedicated to serving justice and the Crown. He is flanked by cocky assistant Jack Barak (Anthony Boyle), who could be a spy for Cromwell. Shardlake is living with scoliosis and is rudely dismissed as a 'crookback' by Tudor society as he carries out his duties. Weathering the verbal abuse, Shardlake and Barak travel to the remote town of Scarnsea to investigate the murder of a commissioner, who was gathering evidence for Cromwell to close the local monastery. The duo are met with hostility and suspicion as they seek answers from Abbot Fabian (Babou Ceesay) and a secretive brotherhood including Edwig (David Pearse), Gabriel (Miles Barrow), Guy (Irfan Shamji), Jerome (Paul Kaye) and Mortimus (Brian Vernel)

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings
